GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My father was the first man that struck me, and the first that I put into the ground for it.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Craul will tend your land, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: You have not heard of Craul? It was I who made the desert of Hengameh bloom, without water. It was I who caused the long grass of ancient Malaya to grow once more, so that the great herds of horse could return. I have made my peace with the Elemental Lords, and they have granted me a special way with the living things that grow upon the land.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The world is a grave and we are its victims.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I do not deny it, friend. I am in need of money. %d gildar buys you my service, and my thanks, and my loyalty.
UnitType.Backstory: I do not seek sympathy; I seek gildar. I seek food. I seek purpose in my life once more; I seek to be of service. But since you ask... I will tell you my tale. It is a familiar enough story, I suppose. My husband... he was a good man, but weak. He drank, he gambled, he lost our money... a merchant came to our house, we could not pay, and so this merchant asked our daughter in exchange for forgiveness of our debt. I killed him, and then... I had to leave, of course. But before I did... I killed my husband as well, because he would have done the same thing again.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'As long as the mountains stand, I will not fall.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service, perhaps. If you wish to hire me. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: My previous experience? I kept ledgers for my uncle - Karlo Butari, who was second on the Merchants Council in Serrano. I have been to the West, yes, but my loyalties are here, if you are asking. I am Krax, through and through, in my heart, though because of my travels, I do not share the accent, as you have no doubt noticed. I am seeking new employment, friend - actively seeking, for I lost everything I had recently. It is only through my skill with the staff that I escaped with my life. The caravan I was shepherding... we were en route to a city called Bruze, and these things came out of the desert... they breathed fire upon us. It was like a story out of the old days. Monsters, they were. These are dangerous lands, my friend.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'All I need is food to eat and pockets to pick.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Pay me %d gildar and point me towards your enemies.
UnitType.Backstory: I was a thief, yes; I am a soldier by trade now. A fighter. I do not apologize for my past; I was an orphan, I did what was necessary to survive. Some good came of it as well; there are none who can work in the darkness, in close quarters, as skillfully as I. But now I seek fellowship, security, a good wage for an honest day's service.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It is time for the strong to retake Elemental.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: It is Miredesi of the Quendar who stands before you, stranger. I offer my staff, my spirit, to your service, for the price of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Dark times are upon us, stranger. The Oracle has risen. The Elemental Lords of old have broken free of their chains, and seek revenge upon all the world. Soon Delin's fire will fill the skies once more, I have foreseen this. The weak will scatter to all corners of the earth; the strong will seek a leader to follow, to guide them through the storms that are to come. A new sovereign to seize Curgen's throne... are you the one, stranger? I cannot see. I cannot tell. But Miredesi is willing to aid you, in your quest, if you will have her.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My dagger can reach to anywhere a shadow touches.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You need companions, my friend. You could do worse than Nochd. I know the old roads here. %d gildar buys you my knowledge - my company - my protection.
UnitType.Backstory: My story? I was not always a soldier-at-arms. I was a merchant once - my brother and I were partners. We came from Sigidd-Belzen, a town far from here. A town no longer, not since the transformation. Everything changed then - my brother changed then. Something died inside him - money became his god. He made it seem as if I had stolen from another man - he framed me, and I was jailed, and he took all our money, all the wealth and things we had accumulated, and he left. He left me with nothing. I do not have a brother anymore. Well. I have spoken longer than I intended.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My story is now interwoven with yours.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Straavni, my friend. Greetings. I am Ruah. I sense a kindred spirit in you... a spirit bent on ordering the chaos of this world. I would assist you in your quest, for only a small fee. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: These are dangerous lands... death is never far. For a price, Ruah will walk with you, will bring her dagger to bear where it is needed. Death and I, we are becoming good friends. We met here, in this very place, not long ago. In the ravine there, I came upon a man I knew. His name was Kronyu, he was a simple mill worker, only not so simple as it turns out... you see, there had been some killings in my village. Five murders, and there was great fear among my people, for we thought the sorcerer we had driven out - a man named Meerduul - we thought he had returned. But there in the ravine, on this day... I came upon Kronyu, as I said. Kronyu, and a dead woman. He was holding her in his arms, he had one hand around her throat, and in the other... he held a tool he had taken from the mill. He had driven it through her neck, and he was holding her tightly, so she could not scream. Holding her and staring into her eyes, and there was blood everywhere, and he was just... staring. Staring into the face of death. And when it was done, he dropped her to the ground, and turned, and then he saw me. And you would think I would have been scared, I was no warrior then, but I knew somehow... I was safe. And soon after this... Kronyu and I became lovers. We lived together. He worked at the mill, and some days... he would kill. This we never spoke of, but... I began to wonder. I began to dream. Dreams of dark gods and dying men. Dreams of what it might be like to kill someone, myself. And then one night... Kronyu was sleeping. And through my head ran all the questions about what killing felt like, and I thought first of waking him. But I knew he could not tell me what it felt like with words. And so... I took a knife from near the fire. It was covered in blood, from a chicken we had cooked for our dinner. I took that knife, and I lay down next to Kronyu. Very close. He was warm... I could feel his breath going in and out. I felt the beating of his heart; I smelt the cut wood of the mill on his hair. I slipped the knife into him. Up beneath his ribs. He came awake with a start, and saw me, and ... he tried to move away, but I held him close. He tried to talk, but I covered his mouth. I looked into his eyes, and waited, and after a time... It is strange, I know, to speak of such terrible things. But these are terrible times, my friend. Ruah can help you get through them, you will see.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Do not discard the bent and broken, it can be remade.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Shalaam, stranger. I am Skuzu. I am a weaponsmith. If you will pay me %d gildar, I will make sure the blades of your warriors are never dull.
UnitType.Backstory: It gives me the greatest pleasure to make a fine weapon; in the Shaman's war, I was armorer to Shak Uzman, responsible for the swords and armor of a hundred great warriors. Allow me to assist you in the wars you plan, stranger, and you will not be sorry.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'There is nothing greater than standing triumphant over others.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar hires me. Neither of us have ever lost a fight.
UnitType.Backstory: Metal and muscle is what I have to offer you, stranger. If you are interested, speak. If not, move on. I will find others who are.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Behold a paladin of industry, waging war upon idle hands!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: If you truly seek to create an empire, my skills as an administrator will save you a fortune. For %d gildar, I will gladly aid you.
UnitType.Backstory: You will find me a man of few words, yet I promise you they will be insightful ones. Efficiency is my watchword; foresight in planning my policy. I shall make sure your citizens work hard for you.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: None under my charge will fall.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: It's Hannis of the Far Mountains who greets you and offers her loyalty. What would you say a good warrior is worth? Shall we bargain? %d gildar?
UnitType.Backstory: Aye, some call me braggart. They said the same of fair Ithuane herself now, did they not, back in the old days? It's not bragging to be confident in one's skills. It's not bragging if your sword can back up your words, to my way of thinking. People who don't care for me don't know me, is what I think. And you don't know me yet, do you? I'll travel with you a piece, friend, for the price I named, and if you find my companionship or my skills wanting, well then we'll go our separate ways. Now you couldn't ask for fairer than that, could you?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I will follow you to the battle's heart.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'm for hire, yes. Out to make my way in the world. My fee? What sounds fair to you? %d gildar?
UnitType.Backstory: Can't say I'm the greatest fighter, no, but I'm willing to learn. And there's other things I know - my grandfather had books, you see. Parts of books, anyway. Parts of Hosten's Codex, yes, that's right. You have things you want to know about those kinds of spells... I'm your man.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Pain and injury flee from my touch like shadows before the dawn. Allow my service and I will restore your strength and your men.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am no common soldier, friend. I claim descent from the house of Amarian, and the line of Dariun the Gray as well. My staff is for hire at the entirely reasonable price of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Please step back, or you will muddy my boots.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Life is cruel, but not nearly as much as I.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hire me. %d gildar. I will protect you and yours.
UnitType.Backstory: This hammer speaks for me. I am not good with words. Brillda, she who was my wife, she was good with words. She was good with my sons. But they are dead now, so the need for words is gone.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'One great find and I can rest my tired feet for good.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You have gildar? You need fighters? Then I am your man - %d gildar, or its equal in metals or goods, is my price.
UnitType.Backstory: My given name is Othollo, friend, though when I was a Knight, I was known as the Blue Dagger. After my favorite weapon, though truth be told, I make do with whatever's at hand. A kitchen knife, a thief's dirk, a pickpocket's blade... the dagger I was known for, though... that was Antheran steel. Made in the time before this one, friend, crafted in Malaya itself... hardest metal in the land. Go straight through armor, you use it right. Galain took it from me, when he stripped me of the blue. There was no honor in that action, friend, as there was no honor in the Knights' behavior during the Revolt. Tandis himself would never have taken sides in that war. We serve all of mankind, not just this king or that. That's who I wish to serve now - I'll follow you, long as you understand that. Long as you know I have higher goals.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Once I walked among the clouds. They call to me still.
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Greetings, friend. I know you will wish to hire my sword in your service. And what a price I give you - %d gildar, far less than a swordman of my rank was meant to earn.
UnitType.Backstory: I am Ralle, who has once been first sword to the Merdici family. Great merchants, whose treasures I was sworn to protect, as I shall protect you and yours if you hire me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The magic I study would never exile me from my people. It remains gloriously indifferent to me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Never again will I swear allegiance to another; but the pursuit of my studies requires money. For %d gildar, I will share my discoveries with you.
UnitType.Backstory: My past? I am an exile; cast out from my home, torn from my loved ones by those who pretended to be my friends, all because I sought to expand my knowledge of the arcane arts. I am loyal now only to my studies; and to the dream I have had since I was a boy, the dream that one day I will find out how to harness those energies to my own purposes.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The wealth of nations is my principal concern.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I have calculated the numbers. %d gildar is the amount you must pay to contract my services.
UnitType.Backstory: I will order your affairs, my friend. That is the primary value I offer. You will find my services a bargain, I am sure.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My plays are all the rage around the Globe'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar, I'll write up a good drama of your rise and fall. Or maybe a tragedy?
UnitType.Backstory: A somewhat skilled bard, Mailliw aspires to write plays. He's even written a few. Mostly tragedies with extremely high body count. Nobles seem to like his plays though, and so Mailliw continues to playwright. When asked about his name, he merely replies that he was a very nervous spearman before he discovered his skill with words. Other reports seem to imply that he's a bit of a rabble-rouser despite being a playwright.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'People cannot be trusted as a cog or lever can.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Dark times these are, my friend. But for %d gildar I can share with my insights; my thoughts on how best to survive, and even prosper.
UnitType.Backstory: I have made it my life's work to study the lost magicks of Antheros; to rediscover the principles of the great engineers, who built the siege towers of Redstone. I would put these skills to your service, friend, I would build you great machines to help you achieve your goals, should you hire me to your service.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I have lost all that I have ever known.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I will keep safe what is yours, stranger. For %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: This bow is of the yrilla tree - it was given to me by the peoples of the jungle, by the Drota. Some say they enchant their weapons, but I believe it to be the wood itself... its color, its strength, its flexibility. It is the perfect killing weapon, to me. Most among my people would not think so. The Quendar believe that death is to be dealt face-to-face - that there is honor only in a killing blow given by your hand, to your enemy at close range. This my father believed, but he and my brothers were slaughtered by D'rog spearmen - Trog warriors - who dared not face them in hand-to-hand combat. As all Quendar must, I have mastered the art of unarmed combat. But my preferred weapon - always - is the bow. I fight not for honor. I fight to kill.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Your gold and your life. Nothing personal.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Poena worries for you, my friend. The path before you is filled with dangerous creatures. It is in your best interest to pay Poena a small fee - %d gildar - to smooth your way forward. Yes?
UnitType.Backstory: Long has Poena walked these roads, my friend. Since I was a girl, in the village of Um Kafarei, and my father would send me with a basket of calivar to trade with the Deladda people. It is from the Deladda that I have this axe, which their chieftain tells me came from the time before this one, from the time when great Kir-Tion walked the world.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: ''There is great delight in suffering, for those that survive it.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: The scorpion's skills can be enlisted in your service for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Fairy tale? Who has told you this? Rahelle's story is no fairy tale, but the simple truth. In the year after the Black Summer, I was forced to cross the deserts of the south alone, on horseback. A day's ride from my home, my mount sickened, and died. I burned in the Sun's fires, and fell into the sands, convinced I had met my end. But the Destiny answered my prayers, and sent to me a thousand scorpions, who bore me upon their backs to the safety of a hermit's cave. Since that day, I have been immune to the scorpion's venom. Since that day, my dagger carries within it the scorpion's sting.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Like my ancestor before me, I'll hit the bull's eye! And "borrow" some gildar.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Howdy. I think you need a good ranger. Well, here I am! That said, I'm going to need %d gildar from you. It's for, hum, charity!
UnitType.Backstory: Said to be a descendant of some folk hero who gave to the poor. Whether she, on the other hand, "gives to the poor" is questionable. She doesn't mind taking from the rich though, calling it her "wages". Despite her thieving ways, she is capable with a bow, so hiring her doesn't just mean losing gildar, it means losing gildar to someone who is capable of hitting a target. Gotta take what you can, right?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Drink this. You'll feel better. Maybe.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Potions! Poultices! Remedies! %d gildar a pop!
UnitType.Backstory: Toc'Dor is a young Trog shaman who has journeyed some distance hoping to make some money selling various... natural remedies. Surprisingly, despite his relative youth, he's actually quite skilled, and sells most of his wares for decent prices.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Great kingdoms require great planning. That's where I come in.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Turin Mafaru's fee is %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A great empire requires great planning, my friend. Turin Mafaru has raised cities from deserts; you would do well to hire me.

UnitType.Quote: 'Great kingdoms require great planning. That's where I come in.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A great empire requires great planning, my friend. Turin Mafaru has raised cities from deserts; you would do well to hire me.

UnitType.Quote: 'This world has taken much from me. It's time I got something in return!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Do not fear Vasim. I am fighter for hire now. I cost %d gildar - a good deal for you, stranger.
UnitType.Backstory: These are dangerous lands, stranger. Dangerous times. I have seen much... I tell you story. Vasim's story. I am from Bruze - you have heard of it? Well, it does not matter. Bruze is - was - great city. City of survivors. City of fighters. But this world... Titans were dangerous, yes, but more dangerous still... the Anthuanii... yes, these things are real, I have seen them... Bruze was near wildlands, great swamp... the Vassyulka, we call it... these creatures come out of swamp, first only a few, but then more and more, and Vazim's brothers are killed, Vasim's family is killed, whole city is gone... dangerous times, my friend. I have fought these things, and they must be destroyed, as the Titans intended. As Curgen intended. You will see this, Vasim is sure. When you do... Vasim is with you. Vasim and his axe.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'This world has taken much from me. It's time I got something in return!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.

UnitType.Quote: 'I lost it all once, but I will atone for my weakness.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Your cause seems just, my friend. Just and righteous, and I would join with you for free, but you see... I have debts I need to deal with. Some men that must be paid. %d gildar, I must ask for my services.
UnitType.Backstory: My story? It is one you have heard before, I am sure. Perhaps you have even heard my name, or the name of my family. Bacco Aurelia Lamord. In the time before this one, the Lamord, we were a great merchant family, my great-grandfather, he was a councillor for the Serrane, we had an estate in the hills near the Western Sea, and... those things, they were most of them destroyed in the great affarenze, the Cataclysm, and those that were left - my family's money... you see, when you know fine things... you acquire a taste for them. I acquired a taste for them, and for money, and so I gambled, you see. With what there was left to us, you see, I was reckless. And now there is nothing. My family... they will not speak to me. My sisters, my nephew... they live in a hut. A hut. No. I am determined to make this right. To restore honor to myself, and my family, and yes, to the world. If you give me a chance, I will prove myself, I swear it.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Only those brave enough to rebel can know true freedom.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Arcturus's axe is yours to hire, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Arcturus fought with Tarth, in the days of the Arena. Together, Tarth and Arcturus spilled the blood of tyrants. Fought for the people. Arcturus fights always for the people. But if you hire Arcturus, he does what you say. But Arcturus tells you, he is best at killing tyrants.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My mind kept me alive in the darkest of days. I cannot abandon it.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Knowledge of this world... knowledge of the world that was... those things are all I possess. They came to me at great cost. To put them, and myself, at your disposal... I must ask a fee. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: How I came to know these things? It was fate; the hand of the Destiny. When I was young, I was stricken with a disease, one that should have killed me, and yet somehow I managed to survive. But afterwards... I was never the same. I spent much time indoors. There was a ruin near our village, a library of sorts. I would go there, and read, rather than play with the other children. The more I learned, the more I wished to know. And that remains true to this day.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I like to think of myself as a wizard of words when it comes to gildar.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: It'll be %d gildar for me to join you, and for that you'll get your money back many times over, I can guarantee, for I'll build your nation into a great kingdom.
UnitType.Backstory: Aye, some say I dress like the barmaid I was once, but it's not my dress you'd be paying me for, is it? I know the worth of a man's work, and a woman's too, and the worth of the things they make, and I know how to get the best out of any deal. And I don't believe in cheating, I believe you don't need to make enemies to make money, you're better off playing fair with anyone you bargain with. My father relied on me from the time I was a young girl to deal with the merchants who came round, and I did that well enough, and then the master of an inn near us, he hired me to do his books, and manage his affairs, and soon enough... well, here I am. Some say I have a silver tongue, and maybe that's so, but I don't think it's trickery to point out the value of a thing.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.

UnitType.Quote: 'All great leaders need a right-hand man!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Friend, I am glad to see you. Glad to meet you. Do you have food? Do you have money? Would you hire me on to join you? %d gildar buys you my sword arm, and my undying loyalty.
UnitType.Backstory: I admire your ambition, friend, and I think you're right. Dark days now, yes, but darker times are coming. The Fallen - the grayskins, all of them, Urxen and Trog, Wraith and Quendar, and I count the traitors from Kraxis in there too - they are planning something. Is that salt pork, by the way? Could I have a piece?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Reason and logic are my shield and blade, respectively.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can fight, yes. But I prefer to out-think my enemies. I'll out-think yours, if you hire me on. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I don't mean to be curt, friend. I want your coin, yes. But I must tell you I am a private person. I prefer the company of books to the company of people. Just so we understand each other. I'll withdraw now, let you make your decision about hiring me on or not.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I stand before you as a bastion of hope! Rejoice!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Do you desire to make this world a safer place? Then I am your man. I would hire into your service, for a small fee of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I am Joffery Halleson, and you may have heard my name before, friend, for I, like my father and grandfather before me, like all Hallesons from the time of the Emperor Hosten, he who the Titan Curgen called Nemesis, have been privileged to wear the colors of the Azure Knights. I do so no longer for reasons which are mine, and mine alone, but I tell you that as long as you will have me, I will swear myself to your service. Many will tell you I have no peer in combat, friend, and though I cannot speak to the truth of those words myself, lest I be considered braggart, I tell you that with a weapon in hand, I have never known defeat.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Who knows what treasures this broken world holds?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Good day to you friend. Shall we agree, you need my blade; I need your coin. %d gildar sounds a fair price, yes?
UnitType.Backstory: Klunni the clown? No, who has told you this? Klunni is not clumsy. Klunni takes risks; Klunni goes forth boldy where others fear to step. The lords of old, they were clever, they protected their treasure well, but Klunni does not fear to explore their tombs, their temples. Klunni will share the treasure he finds with you, my friend, if you are bold enough to hire him in your service. If not - it is a wide world, and Klunni will find another sovereign to pay his fee!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The beauty of antiquity is not lost on me, even when it is hidden to others.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I want to see the world put back together again, friend. I want to see greatness before I die. If you'll have me, I'll join your cause, for the proper price. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I was raised in the far mountains, in the shadow of what was Aivern. The great towers, friend, I could see what was left of them outside the window of my hut each night. My brothers and I, we played in those ruins when we were young. They played at war, and I played at building. Now I don't play. Now that building's what I do, friend. Lok Karney, in the near Skarps... I'm the Tearny who saw those tunnels dug right. Now that mine is giving iron to those people once more. Not making 'em rich, no, but at least they're surviving. And I can do better. I can do more. More for you, if you'll have me.

UnitType.Quote: 'This world asks many questions, all of which I will answer in time.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I, Ulfnir, will fight for you. Will teach for you. %d gildar is my price.
UnitType.Backstory: In the arena at Capitar, I learned to wield the axe. In the arena, too, I learned of the Decalon, the ten notebooks Ezmir filled with learning of ages past. Teachings of Aerus Aelmann, of Josryn the Just... these I have studied, and will share with you, if you hire me.

When she sings, it sets the souls of her listeners ablaze, and some have sought her out to inspire their troops. Befitting her fiery enthusiasm, she is just as capable a fire mage as bard.

UnitType.Quote: 'I was groomed to understand defense. It's all I know.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am more than a simple warrior. Hire me, and you will receive far more worth than the %d gildar you will spend.
UnitType.Backstory: Perhaps you will find better fighters than Diruuna. Perhaps. I will tell you I am of the clan Herakii, and those of my blood are counted among the fiercest warriors of the Quendar. But I give you not only strength of arms; I give you knowledge gleaned from the enchanters of fallen Imperium, for those who raised me intended to apprentice me to the dark sorcerer, and in preparation for that, I was schooled in the ways of the arcane. Tomes from the age of the Magi, from Al-Ashteroth, knowledge of the great channelers and their ways, the creatures they created and mastered... I know these things as well as any now living. Hire me to your cause, and I give that knowledge to you as well.

UnitType.Quote: 'I am a healer of ills, those of of body, mind, and spirit.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Fair met, friend. I am Keirgann, of the Iron Tribes. Of the far mountains. I am a healer. My services can be hired for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The money I ask is only enough to live on - to be able to gather the things I need, the herbs and talismans and what-not. That's my cause, friend, and the only one I care about. Aye, I'll fight if I have to - this hammer is a weapon, not a tool - but to my way of thinking, there's been enough fighting in this world to last a thousand years. Enough fighting, enough death... time to fix things, I say. Time to heal them, before it's too late.

UnitType.Quote: 'When only the strongest survive, we will defeat the Fallen.'

UnitType.Backstory: This is new armor, yes. Has seen only five seasons. But only because old armor was ruined. Burned. A great battle I was in - at the Vasyulka, the wildlands... many were killed. Pink and gray skin fought together, against Ignys, and Anthuanii... we killed them too, but not enough. I have learned new ways to kill now... I can show you. I will show you, if you will hire me.

UnitType.Quote: 'The power of the ancestors flows through the totems!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I need some gildar. %d gildar oughta do the trick.
UnitType.Backstory: While playing with some friends one time, Ozanas came across something he thought was a neat little carving. But when he held it, he felt power flow through his veins. He eventually left home and travelled until he came across someone who could tell him the purpose of the carved item. When informed that it was a totem of a long lost village, he decided to try and make some of his own, using his ancestors spirits to give him power.

UnitType.Quote: 'In my land, we deal harshly with those who would cheat us.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My skills have a price - %d gildar. My honor does not.
UnitType.Backstory: My people are Quendar - we were born and bred to serve the greatest of the Titans, Curgen of the Dred'nir, and from him and those who followed him we learned... well. I will tell you a story. There was a merchant once, a Krax named Sarrad, of the clan of the same name, who thought himself clever, who thought to cheat me of money that was rightfully mine, and the reason you have never heard of this Sarrad or his clan is because they do not exist anymore. None of them. Not the merchant, nor his brothers, nor his wives, or daughters, or sons. And that is what I and my people learned from Curgen, whose name is undying.

UnitType.Quote: 'I was born to gentle parents, but that time is past. In this age a sharp wit is no challenge for a sharp blade.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Halt, stranger. I bid you Straavni - hello, in the language of my people. Are you seeking swords to hire? My services are %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Ruka's story? It is a simple one. Lesson I learned from my father. Make this world a better place. He was Lekktor of Sigedd-Belsen - leader of village elders. A good talker, not so good a fighter. This is why he is dead. When the transformation came... all was chaos. Many fled, my father stayed. Tried to help others. He was killed. Free Riders rescued me. Taught me to fight. I have this sword from them, and I am expert in this use. Hire me. I will show you. I will prove it to you.

UnitType.Backstory: Sulowa has long sought a sovereign to pledge his strength to - a leader who will raise the peoples of the East to glory once more. I think you are that leader, yes? I think you will be Az-Adoras, come again, to make the desert sands bloom, and the great jungles grow once more.

UnitType.Quote: 'I will never let down my guard again.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: It'll cost you %d gildar to hire me, and that's a more than fair bargain, my friend.
UnitType.Backstory: I wasn't always a wanderer, you see. Once I was a captain - the chief bodyguard of this merchant from Ithul. I lived like a king, then, at least compared to most from the wastes. Three squares, and a dozen men at my beck and call, and this woman... well, there's no use in talking about the past. It was an assassin, snuck past the night watch, killed the merchant... not my fault, but my responsibility, and so... But I still have this sword. And there's not a man walks this world who has more skill with it than I. All I want is a chance to serve again.

UnitType.Quote: 'What passes effortlessly through steel and turns flesh to ash? What cannot be caged and turns night to day? That which I command.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar buys my spear, friend. And your safety.
UnitType.Backstory: Some will tell you they fought in the Arena, friend, and that makes them good hires for you. Makes them worth your coin. I'm here to tell you that's wrong. Arena fighting, that's not real fighting. You don't get boundaries out here in the real world. You don't get rules. You don't get someone giving you the word to begin. Out here, wargs'll rip your throat while you're sleeping. Darklings'll spear you from behind without a word of warning. I ought to know; I was raised in the shadow of the Fissure, and things come out of there ain't never been dreamed of in the Arena. Sure, my father fought in the Arena, but his people were from the North, from the Free Cities, and they knew the kinds of things that were out there in the world, even before the Cataclysm. Those things are out there still, friend. You hire me, I'll keep you safe from 'em best I can.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It's probably going to be an hour of wolves and shattered shields this day!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hey there, I'm looking to do a lot of walking and other stuff. Mind tossing me %d gildar? I need to fix my sword.
UnitType.Backstory: Rumors abound about the somewhat mysterious Elegorn. Some even imply that he might be a lost king! Probably not true, though. What is known is that he's been wandering for quite some time, working for some wizard or mage or something and that he's not too bad with a bow or a sword.

UnitType.Quote: 'Cutting corners cost me everything once. Never again.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am a learned and capable adminstrator. For %d gildar, I will reinforce the infrastructure of your sovereignty.
UnitType.Backstory: You asked, and so I'll tell you. In the mines my family worked in, we had If you give charge of a task to me, my friend, you can rest easy I'll see it done. I tolerate no foolishness; I run things efficiently, and I'll tell you why. When I was a young girl, in the far mountains, we were always under attack by bandits. And this one time - I had helped build a palisade protecting our city, and the man who was in charge, I knew he'd done flawed work, but I kept my mouth shut. Kept my mouth shut, and those bandit devils - the Hassainii, I'm sure you've heard tell of them - they ran right over the wall. Knocked it down, no trouble. Ten people died that night, and that was on me as much as anyone. I'll work your people night and day to see things done right.

UnitType.Quote: 'It is a wasting disease, if you are curious. It should have killed me years ago.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I will follow you, if you wish. Obey your commands. My price is %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: It is a wasting disease, if you are curious. It should have killed me years ago. It has scarred me. Parts of my body... there is little more than bone, and a thin layer of flesh. It is not a pretty sight, I would not inflict it upon others, and so I wear these robes. They help to hide my staff as well. I am not without power; I have mastered death, in a sense, and so I know how to summon it. Not as a channeler, of course - but I have knowledge of the body, a man's weak points, areas where the veins are close to the surface, where a small cut can inflict great damage, where the bones are fragile, where a certain amount of pressure can kill. These are the skills I can offer - if you are interested.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Many will offer you their sword, but none will have a blade like mine.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My sword is yours, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Many will offer you their sword, but none will have a blade like mine. You see the edge? Do not touch; the steel will slice through bone like a blade through butter. It was passed on to me by my uncle, who had it from one of the last of the Antheran guardsman; there were jewels in the hilt once, you can see, but they were long ago pried out by thieves. The steel itself has far greater value; it is Antheran, I was told, and will hold its edge forever. I do not brag to tell you I have killed two score with it, man and grayskin alike. And that is another thing I must tell you about myself; a thing that was told to me by a Drota shaman I had chance to meet once, long ago, in a place far from here. She would not share a boat with me, and my family; she claimed I carried an aura about my person, an aura of death. Perhaps she was right, for the very next afternoon, as our ship crossed a span of open sea, a sudden squall capsized us, and all were lost, passengers and crew, save for myself. My parents, my brother... but this aura has taken others as well. In battle. A man I wounded fell backwards, and slipped, and split his head on a rock. I do not know if you take much stock in what shamans and the like have to say; if you do, then there is that to consider as well.

UnitType.Quote: 'My blade and I are a nightmare from which you'll never wake...'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hire Tsomok's sword, stranger, and you will win all the wars of your days. %d gildar is my fee.
UnitType.Backstory: Many battles have I fought in; many foes have I slain. This sword I carry was a gift to my people long, long ago, in the time before this one. It is an enchanted blade; with it, I slew Umana Noress, queen of the Drota. Its point pierced her skin, and turned her heart to ice. With the flat of its blade, I turned the flesh of her daughters to snow, and cast her evil from the world forever.

UnitType.Quote: 'I lost my past and found a blade. An odd trade-off, to say the least.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I do my talking with this axe. Put %d gildar in my pocket, and I'll speak wherever, whenever, you want me to.
UnitType.Backstory: My experience, young friend? I fought in the revolt, alongside Relias himself. Brother taking up sword against brother...sons fighting their fathers. It was bloody work, young friend. None of us who fought in that war.. on either side... cared much for it, I can tell you. But it was fighting that needed to be done. They say the Titans are gone, but there's plenty of grayskins in this world yet, and every one of 'em needs killing, far as I'm concerned. Though if you're paying me... you'll tell me when and where to swing the blade.

UnitType.Quote: 'Sometimes lost is exactly where you need to be.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar, and my sword will sing for you, friend.
UnitType.Backstory: I call her Ithuane, friend - my sword. After the girl in the song? You know it, of course. No? Well you know the story, I am sure. A sad story, a tragedy, the tale of a love that could never be. Ithuane and Pariden. Mortal, and Titan. Is it true? Who knows? But the song... I could sing it for you. I'm a fair singer, not as good as my father was, but then that's all he did. He sang for Procipinee, you know. More than once. Much as she liked his singing, you would think she would have gone after the bastards who killed him with a little more alacrity. I took care of them, though. With my Ithuane, right here. That's what I focus my energies on. The sword. My girl. Something useful. Something practical. In this world now... that's all that matters.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Ars longa, vita brevis.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
It was the night of haunted dreams, when Shirayn's scream echoed across the world of Elemental, when the boundary between life and death was torn. A thousand strange things happened that night. In the abattoir of Khaffara blood pooled and ran up the slaughter tables and back into the corpses. Violent whines and thrashing could be heard from a smokehouse in Farcross. In Tarth crows simply fell dead from the sky.
But the most gruesome of these, second only to the pained rebirth of Shirayn herself, was what formed bellow the ancient gallows of Hagudst. For centuries this place had been used for the execution of murderers, traitors and the possessed. Long ago, in an age when a young oracle was locked in a temple, a death cult had been condemned and put to death at the gallows, and their leader swore that death would not stop them, that they would rise again. A noose put an end to their rants, and their corpses were thrown on the bones of the gallows past victims and forgotten.
Their corpses fell to ruin as new corpses buried them, as centuries passed and a cataclysm shook the world, as new empires grew. Until the night of haunted dreams, when the restless spirits of the bone pile finally heard their screams echoed in the world. But these voices no longer had form, there was no single spirit, but an orchestra of suffering and anger. And though a single body rose from the decayed bones and dirt, centuries of spirits went with it.
This Gallowman began walking the dark fields of Elemental, and he was drawn to places of death and pain. The world is full of such places. And though beasts usually avoided him men rarely showed such wisdom. When self-appointed bandit king or foolish hero stopped him Gallowman would reach out to the dead in the area and release the cacophony of spirits he carried with him, allowing them to seek out new forms, to be reborn out of the earth and slaughter the living. And their screaming voices would be dragged back and added to the Gallowman's collection.

UnitType.Quote: 'Men or Fallen, they are all insects to me.'

UnitType.Backstory: Jordur's people were slaves; Jordur is free. Jordur fights for coin now, and to find the lands of his fathers. Jordur's elders sing songs of the Great Ice Mountain, and beasts called Noribuna, whose flesh fed our people for a thousand years. Jordur will use your coin to keep his armor strong, and to pay others to help him in his quest.

UnitType.Quote: 'The key to our salvation exists in the arcane arts.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Peace to you, friend. Liniad is my name, Liniad of the Iron Tribes. I'll hire my mace, and my knowledge of the old ways, to your service, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I was born a miner's daughter, friend. Ten children in my family, the only girl... I never thought to see much of this world growing up, but what happened... I was cooking dinner for my father and brothers, they were in the mines, and came a stranger to our door. Had the whitest skin I'd ever seen in my life. Albino, was my guess, though a little darker, he could have been a grayskin. Friendly enough, though, and he was hurt, I could see that, no danger to me... so I gave him food - my father gave him shelter that night, and he was grateful. Kozma, that was the man's name. Strange name, aye. Well the next morning, after the others had gone off to the mines... this man Kozma reached into his pack, see, and handed me a book. First book I'd ever seen in my life. Thick as a loaf of bread, heavy as a brick... written in all these different languages, as it turns out, though of course I couldn't read a word of any of it, back then. "Dying I am, sweet girl. Sweet Linnaid," the man says to me, in this strange accent he had, one I never heard before, or since. "And I have great treasure," he says. "I hoped to bring book to Queen in the West, but Meerdul..." He made a noise then, like he was in pain, and shook his head. "Now I must leave book with you," he says. "Make use of it. Use of it for good. Promise me." Well, I had no idea what he meant by half of that - Queen in the West? Meerdul? - but I promised him. And we spent that day... he read me parts of the book. Taught me some things, and the next day... Kozma, he died. We buried him high up in the hills - dug the grave myself. Well, I kept my promise to him, or tried to, taught myself to read with the help of a friend of mine, at least the parts of the book that were in common tongue, and by and by... well, you see once you learn how big the world is, you just have to go out and see it, don't you? And that's what happened to me. I had to leave the village. Not as if my father understood, but maybe one day... I can go back. I'd like to go back, once I've done as Kozma asked. Used what's in the book for good. That's my aim.

UnitType.Quote: 'Learn my name and I will defend you, as I have learned Uteran's name that he would defend me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'll march under your banner, friend, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Aye, I can handle myself in battle, friend, but it's my skills as a builder that make me worth the coin I ask. In the village I come from - a place called Gairlach, far to the north of here - my family's had charge of the mines since the time of Hosten himself, and my father, may he rest in peace, he taught me the ways of the engineer when I was not much more than a boy. I know my numbers, and my weights and measures as well as any man. When Lord Immerg needed the towers of New Ithul rebuilt, it was me he called on; I was second engineer on the fortress there as well. I ain't afraid of any job, or any man either, for that matter.

UnitType.Quote: 'Curiosity kills they say. So do I, for the right price.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: In the arena, I became a master of the sword. You can hire me to your cause for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: My blade comes from the time before this one, friend. It was forged by the great smiths of the Iron tribes. I won it it fighting as a slave; I bested a man in combat, and he offered it to me if I would spare his life. I took it and killed him, for by his behavior he dishonored this fine weapon.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It was I that killed my love, not fate. The blame is mine alone.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar, I would be willing to join you.
UnitType.Backstory: Ah yes, the accent... I am from Montenera, you are right, though I left there when I was very young. There was a man who came to our village, his name was Paoluto... he had heard tell of a kouros, a great library, where the wise men of Atalandra had hidden their greatest treasures... well... I was a young girl, Paoluto was a handsome man, and so... I left with him. We traveled east, and then north, into the wastes, and there we found this kouros, and there... Paoluto died. The great treasures of the past... they have great and powerful guardians. Dangerous guardians. You would do well to keep this in mind, friend, and if you see fit to hire me... I shall surely remind you.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'There is an elegance found in ancient devices that I am keen to preserve.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I seek to serve with honor. I seek a sovereign whose interests align with my own, and if you are that leader, my skills are yours to hire, at the price of %d gildar, a sum which I am sure you will agree is more than fair.
UnitType.Backstory: Will you find others more skilled with a sword than myself? Perhaps. Will you find more renowned fighters, or more seasoned tacticians? I am certain you would, if you were to search long and hard enough. What I have to offer is a purity of purpose, friend; an honest heart, a skilled hand, and true devotion to your cause, if I find it worthy. I will tell you that long ago, I was apprenticed to the Azure Knights, intent on joining their ranks myself, though since the time of the Nobles Revolt, the allure of their cause has faded. But the knowledge gained in their service... that burns in my mind still. Knowledge of the Magi's ways... knowledge I will put to the service of a true and well-intentioned leader.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Few can best my spears.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar and I will give you a spear.
UnitType.Backstory: Tahena was always skilled with a spear, up to the point where the going joke was that she secretly married her spear. After a while, she decided to try to become a soldier, but was denied and forced to become a Shaman for her tribe. At this point, she found she could use the shamanistic arts to summon amazingly powerful spears, which would then be supplied to her tribe's warriors. This drew the ire of a rival tribe, who attacked. During the battle, Tahena fled, making off with her best spear.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am the wise, for I know that I know nothing...'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Straavni, my friend. Hello. I am Hyru - the Caller. For a modest fee - shall we say %d gildar? - I will share my knowledge with you.
UnitType.Backstory: You have a great destiny before you, friend. I sense it. A word of caution, though... greatness can be a curse, as well as a blessing. If you will allow me, I will tell you a story. A story of my village in the time before the Oracle came back to us, before the transformation. I was a farmer then, we were all farmers, to coax food from the land required all to work, but when I was not farming, I was a teacher. My village? No. You would not have heard of it... Sigedd-Belzen, it was called. It no longer exists. Only a few of us remain to remember... Yosku, Czillka... and Meerduul, of course. It is his story I wish to tell you... Meerduul, he was student, I was teacher... we were so close, I have no children of my own, I never married, he was like a son to me. Such brilliance... I have studied the past, I know the great alchemic magics of the old kingdoms, but Meerduul... he did not need to study. To him, these things were second nature. He had greatness within him, you see. Now, what happened - this was a few seasons before the transformation, just before the adventurer from the West, Relias, they called him, came to our land... it was a time of great famine. Great drought. and the villagers of Sigedd-Belzen came to me, for I was loremaster, and asked if there was not a way to use sorcery to restore life to the fields. And I said no. And Meerduul said perhaps. In the Book of Ereog it is written how Az-Adoras, the dark prince, brought death to the lands of Hallas. The grain withered in the field, the fruit withered on the vine, the beasts choked on their own bile. Meerduul knew that the death the dark prince had brought was in fact life energy that had been transformed - perverted to a darker use, and he thought... he believed it was his destiny to restore life to the lands of Sigedd-Belzen. We all told him, you see, that he was meant for greatness, and he believed us. And so he went into the fields, and gathered around him the mana - the energy - he needed to perform this spell of life. And he cast that energy into the earth itself, and tried to draw from it life. And he did. We were so happy, the fields bloomed once more, the grasses grew, there were crops... but only for a short time. A single day. Because the next dawn, when we woke... life had fled the land entirely. Meerduul's spell had drawn the last breath from the fields, and now they were naught but sand, and stone. But that was not the worst thing, my friend. The worst thing was when he wanted to try again. The worst thing was when we had to fight him... to drive him from his home, and his people, for he would not listen to reason. And now he is lost to me, my son, my heir as loremaster. Lost as all of Sigedd-Belzen is lost. That is the story I wished to tell you, about the dangers of greatness.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To burn, to blow, to burrow and flow.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Fellow traveler, fellow seeker, be still a moment. The spirits of this world, they are calling. You do not hear them? Ah... for a mere %d gildar, I will tell you what they say.
UnitType.Backstory: It is the Anthuanii of which I speak - the ancient ones. They live in the great shards - in the dark of night, in the still of the dreamtime, they whisper their desires. I heard them only after the Transformation, after the return of the Oracle. I fled from my home to quiet their voices, but they followed me across the wastes. Take me into your service, and I will help you learn their secrets, help you learn to master their magicks.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: I am quicker than thought.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar is my fee, and a pittance to pay for my services.
UnitType.Backstory: My eye is keen, friend. My speed second to none; I have no peer in the art of the sword. I strike without mercy; without warning. If you do not hire me, you will regret it. That is no threat, no boast, but simply a statement of fact. You may ask any soldier, any mercenary whose path you cross, and they will second these words. They will speak of Norii in hushed tones, and with only the greatest respect.

UnitType.Quote: 'Singing for the one I have lost is all that I have left.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Would you be willing to give me %d gildar? I want to rebuild my kingdom. Just to be sure, there aren't any sorcerers in your kingdom, are there?
UnitType.Backstory: A wandering bard, Prince Edward Muirion lost his kingdom and sole Shard to a Sorcerer's empire. When the empire attacked, the Sorcerer's daughter he had fallen in love with perished. The Sorcerer blamed the bard for her death and spent years chasing down Edward. Since then he has wandered, avoiding sorcerers at all costs while playing his songs.

UnitType.Quote: 'Will you allow me to heal you and your men?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar will allow me to fund my... studies.
UnitType.Backstory: As a child, Statia wanted to be a healer. When the village shaman started to train her in his arts, she quickly found out how much she loved poisons just as much as she liked to heal the ill. When the shaman died mysteriously, though, she was instantly found at fault due to her mithridatism and driven out of the village. Now she wanders, plying her abilities as a healer, and avoiding revealing her backstory as a mistress of poisons.

UnitType.Quote: 'Let the cowards run, I need only the courageous.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'll help you, if you wish for %d gildar. Or I fight you - no charge!
UnitType.Backstory: I am making a joke with you, stranger. I fight only for money but I will make a wager with you, Sculla against any champion you choose. I will fight blindfolded. I am without fear, it is how my father raised me. My father was a great soldier in the city of Bruze. When I was a girl I trained with Bruze soldiers to make my father proud. I fight, so his name is not forgotten. Ladmir of Bruze.

UnitType.Backstory: You have not heard of Shimsher? Forty of the Quendar tribe in one battle did I slay, with my axe. And the next day, twelve more. This was in the Battle of the Fist, where the white sands of the desert turned black with blood.

UnitType.Quote: 'Who is my target?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar. I'll take your target.
UnitType.Backstory: A skilled ranger who has a knack for silently and quickly ending the lives of other humanoids from a distance. Rumors and conspiracies abound regarding her possible involvement in the assassination of a high profile and popular Altarian political figure. Theories usually place her on a hill near where the man was assassinated. Some theories even go so far as to claim her name is an anagram for the role she played.

UnitType.Quote: 'I have the blood of the dragon in my veins, and I would share it with you.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am no ordinary fighter, friend - and I sense you are no ordinary traveler. Pay me %d gildar, and I shall gladly join your cause.
UnitType.Backstory: A single name is all we are given, we Urxen. From birth, we are raised as fighters, male and female alike. We are given swords upon our ninth birthday, and on our twelfth, if we have not dishonored them, we may take the name of our tribe as well. I am thus Tann of the Dragonborn. In my nineteenth year, I was raised to command. This was ten years ago; in thefifth year of my command came the Black Summer. That plague took all but a handful of my company, and killed all the elders among the Dragonborn. I myself burned the huts of our village, and now... I am a sellsword, yes. But I am Urxen still. A soldier born and bred. I seek the discipline of an army; I seek a sovereign to follow.

UnitType.Quote: I enjoy battles, when the screams of my enemies join in symphony with those in my mind.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You seek Curgen's throne? I admire your presumption. For %d gildar, I will aid your cause.
UnitType.Backstory: Look not upon this form, mortal. This form does not matter. Look within my eyes to see whose service your coin buys, for in this form dwells the spirit of dread Thannata, who was summoned from the void between worlds by Morrigan himself. In his name I slit the throats of a thousand men, ripped the hearts from brave warriors as they charged upon the battlefield, tore the limbs from their steeds as they tried to flee. Though my flesh rotted long ago, my spirit survived, and thanks to the Patricide's magicks, it can move - I can move - from form to form. This body will soon pass too, though long before it does it will do your cause good service.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I will guard only those who are worthy.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I will accept no less than %d gildar. What is your offer?
UnitType.Backstory: You wish to know more about me? I was once heir to a family most noble, a family whose honor and prestige stood second to none in all the land. But all that honor meant nothing to the merchants who my father owed money to; all that honor meant nothing to the mercenaries sent to collect that money. All that honor could not save him. A dozen years ago, I cast aside that honor, and the name that went with it. I make my own honor now; I make my own way in the world.

UnitType.Quote: 'I'll fight for you. For a price.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I might be interested in joining you. %d gildar would help me make up my mind.
UnitType.Backstory: Expensive? Let me tell you something, friend. Something I learned when I was very young. Antheros is no more. The Azure Knights are not coming back. It's every man for himself out there, in the wastelands. You need a quick mind, and a quicker blade to survive. Fortunately for you, I have both. Hire me, and your worries are over. Well, perhaps not over, but you'll certainly sleep soundly. As long as you can afford to pay me what I'm worth.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I wasn't capable enough back then...I will never say the same again.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar for my services. I can fight, yes - but more to the point, I can help you fight, help you defeat those who have mastered magic. I've studied the arcane for the better part of my life.
UnitType.Backstory:
I will speak of my past this once alone, so you may know who it is you hire. My mother I never knew. My father was Hanar the Axe, whose name was well-known among the gladiators and nobles who fought in Carrodus's arena. He was the greatest fighter I have ever seen, and yes, I saw Tarth himself as well. Many merchants - many men at arms - lost their fortunes when Hanar fought, because the odds against him always seemed impossible. And yet he would always find a way to win.
That was what killed him you see; a man wagered against my father. This man wagered something he did not ever think he would lose - an artifact of some sort, and when my father won, and it passed from his possession... this man was greatly angered. He came to the longhouse we all shared, afterwards... he called my father out.
"Hanar the Axe, they call you," this man said. "I wonder what it would take to kill you, and yours," and by those words, my father thought this man - who I know now to have been a channeler of great power - my father thought the man meant to kill me, and so he raised his axe. And the man raised his arms, and all at once, there was fire everywhere. Fire filling the air, I was by the cooking pots, which were filled with water to be cleaned since we had just eaten our meal, and I hurled myself within one of those pots,
I was small, and so... I survived. No one else did. So what I have seen, with my own eyes... strength of arms is one thing, and yes, it helps to be strong. I am strong, though I may not look so to your eyes. But since that day my father burned... I have sought out knowledge of sorcery. Knowledge of the great spells which belonged to the Magi of the past, to Hosten, and the Oracle. That knowledge will be yours, if you will hire me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Magic is a tool favored by the ambitious usurpers and villains of our world.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I have learned the lore of this world from Shandar himself. I require a fee of %d gildar - paid entirely in advance - to share my knowledge.
UnitType.Backstory: Magic is a thing to be feared, friend. It is a primal power whose behavior none can truly understand. I can help predict what a certain spell has tended to achieve in the past, but there are always complicating factors.

UnitType.Quote: 'Swords are clumsy tools, I barely need to step onto the battelfield to steal a life.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am Listrid of Ravdale. In the last year of the Great Games, I was champion of the Free Woman's Tourney. Hire my services for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I see it burn in your eyes, friend. The warrior's fire; great glory awaits you. Allow me to join your army; I will vanquish your enemies, and help you tame the wastes once more.

The grayskins seek to extend their dominion over the entirety of this world, and we - all the tribes of man, all the countries, all the races, - must band together to stop them. We must pool the knowledge we have in this fight, yes, even that which the scholars of ages past called the black arts. For surely our foes will use those weapons themselves.

UnitType.Quote: 'Grrrrr...'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
Most scholars believe that demons were created by the cataclysm, that they are elementals, pure forms of the world's power that was bound, corrupted and twisted by Curgen. That they were driven mad, that they have come to hate things of flesh and delight in the pain and suffering of those that have reduced their world to ruin.
But evidence of demons stretches well back before the cataclysm. There are stories of creatures that Arnor Tandis battled outside of Gemend that are unlike anything the world has known. The Pits of Grazna are said to contain creatures which feed on madness and sorrow and whose hunger will one day grow to consume the world. And the dark vassal of Lady Umber is mentioned as well, a creature that resembles the beasts of the Jungles of Khaffar, an eternal predator who passes silently between trees, shadows and worlds.
The creatures name is Ascian and the tome says that it served Lady Umber as an assassin because she bound the creature to her with an Amethyst Collar. Since the fall of Umber the creature is said to be free in the world, hunting as it desires and dragging those it stalks into endless darkness.

UnitType.Quote: 'A man is made by his reputation.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: When I fought in the Arena, I took payment in ale. Out here, in this wilderness... best you pay me in gildar for my services. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Fighting's what I do. It's all that I know how to do. Fought Tarth himself to a draw once, in the Arena. And Badra. She says she never lost a fight, but she would've lost to me if the baron's wife hadn't've put her nose in it. Figure now's when I should make some coin off what I do.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I will guard only those who are worthy.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My sword and my skills are for hire, stranger - %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: It is a unique weapon I offer in your service, stranger. Here - I will show you. You can see, the metal itself... it burns, yes, but it is not consumed. If it touches flesh, though... I myself am immune to it, of course. How the blade was enchanted? No, I cannot say. The weapon was given to me by my father - he was - he is - Galain Gaelsen. The hero of Thela's Peak, yes. A great knight, yes. We no longer speak. It is my service you are buying. Ulrik Gaelsen. I have commanded in battle as well.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: If you are patient enough, your prey will come to you.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I intend to prove my worth to all the world. For %d gildar, I'll do that on your behalf.
UnitType.Backstory: The first thing you should know about me is that my grandfather commanded the Imperial bodyguard, in the time before the Cataclysm. He made the Long March, and died with honor when the Emperor fell. His blood flows in my veins; the memory of his deeds burns in my mind, and inspires me. It is because of him that I found this staff; it is because of him that I know how to wield it. It is my duty to seek out the descendants of those who slew him, and repay them in kind. It is a destiny I will fulfill. Some call me braggart for speaking in such a manner. Should you be wise enough to pay my fee, to hire my services, you will discover I am simply speaking truth.

UnitType.Quote: The only commodity more valuable than life is gildar.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'll kill for you. Gladly. Give me %d Gildar and get out of my way.
UnitType.Backstory: What are you looking at?

UnitType.Quote: You should not summon unless you can control? But how are you to practice control except by summoning?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'm out to prove my worth. For %d gildar I'll prove myself to you.
UnitType.Backstory:
Where ever I went fire followed me. First in the destruction of my home and the loss of my parents, and later choking black cloud that consumed the orphanage I was raised in. And I know your thoughts, neither was my doing.
As a young man I was apprenticed to a smith and I was the least surprised to see fire coming again, this time on the heads of Umbrian arrows. The other villagers stupidly attempted to put out the fires, making them easy targets for the archers. Some tried to escape, but the Umbrian raiders waited for them in the darkness.
I ran into the fire, into the great council house at the village's center. Its thatched roof blazed like a new sun, the walls would fuel the fire for hours. Burning sedge fell down around me like demonic rain. I could hear the raiders moving through the village, I could hear their sharp, guttural voices. I could hear their hate.
And I could hear other voices too. As hungry and eager as the Umbrian raiders, as eager to pillage and consume. I had hundreds of burns and I thought I would never get the taste of smoke out of my throat. I screamed and the voices screamed back.
But in the morning the raiders were gone and I was the only one alive, though I wasn't alone. I could still hear the fires whispers, and when I bid them come, they obeyed.

UnitType.Quote: The only commodity more valuable than life is gildar.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'm out to prove my worth. For %d gildar I'll prove myself to you.
UnitType.Backstory: My name is Pralius, friend. I was of the Dragonborn, a great legion we were. Strong fighters. We struck as one, in battle. Then came the Black Summer. All was lost then. My wife... what happened to her. She suffered, friend, until I could stand her suffering no more. I did what I had to, but I know this. That was no ordinary plague. It was sorcery - dark sorcery, and I know who was responsible. I will find him, and when I do... you see my sword? The blade is not metal, no. I do not know what it is, exactly, it was fashioned for me... careful, do not touch. It is quite toxic. I shall use it in your service, happily, when the need arises. But know that I shall bury it in the heart of he who is responsible for my wife's death when I find him. But fear not. I have other weapons to put at your disposal.

UnitType.Quote: 'This world is mine.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Once, he was a holy man. A Son of the Dragon; a worshipper of Elemental's most primal, powerful creatures. Their warden; their protector. Then Curgen sent the slave armies of the Quendar after Waerloga and his charges; in response, Waerloga took up the Scepter of Tan-La-Ur, and bound the dragons to his will. For seven long, bloody years, he waged war against the armies of Imperium; a war that ended with his defeat, and imprisonment within the darkest of all Curgen's dungeons, the Pit of Lost Voices. There are some who say he waits there still, brooding and silent, seeking only the chance to win his escape, and wreak vengeance upon the world.

UnitType.Quote: 'I lost it all once, but I will atone for my weakness.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Your cause seems just, my friend. Just and righteous, and I would join with you for free, but you see... I have debts I need to deal with. Some men that must be paid. %d gildar, I must ask for my services.
UnitType.Backstory: My story? It is one you have heard before, I am sure. Perhaps you have even heard my name, or the name of my family. Bacco Aurelia Lamord. In the time before this one, the Lamord, we were a great merchant family, my great-grandfather, he was a councillor for the Serrane, we had an estate in the hills near the Western Sea, and... those things, they were most of them destroyed in the great affarenze, the Cataclysm, and those that were left - my family's money... you see, when you know fine things... you acquire a taste for them. I acquired a taste for them, and for money, and so I gambled, you see. With what there was left to us, you see, I was reckless. And now there is nothing. My family... they will not speak to me. My sisters, my nephew... they live in a hut. A hut. No. I am determined to make this right. To restore honor to myself, and my family, and yes, to the world. If you give me a chance, I will prove myself, I swear it.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'All great leaders need a right-hand man!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Friend, I am glad to see you. Glad to meet you. Do you have food? Do you have money? Would you hire me on to join you? %d gildar buys you my sword arm, and my undying loyalty.
UnitType.Backstory: I admire your ambition, friend, and I think you're right. Dark days now, yes, but darker times are coming. The Fallen - the grayskins, all of them, Urxen and Trog, Wraith and Quendar, and I count the traitors from Kraxis in there too - they are planning something. Is that salt pork, by the way? Could I have a piece?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am a healer of ills, those of of body, mind, and spirit.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Fair met, friend. I am Keirgann, of the Iron Tribes. Of the far mountains. I am a healer. My services can be hired for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The money I ask is only enough to live on - to be able to gather the things I need, the herbs and talismans and what-not. That's my cause, friend, and the only one I care about. Aye, I'll fight if I have to - this hammer is a weapon, not a tool - but to my way of thinking, there's been enough fighting in this world to last a thousand years. Enough fighting, enough death... time to fix things, I say. Time to heal them, before it's too late.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Grrrrr...'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory:
Most scholars believe that demons were created by the cataclysm, that they are elementals, pure forms of the world's power that was bound, corrupted and twisted by Curgen. That they were driven mad, that they have come to hate things of flesh and delight in the pain and suffering of those that have reduced their world to ruin.
But evidence of demons stretches well back before the cataclysm. There are stories of creatures that Arnor Tandis battled outside of Gemend that are unlike anything the world has known. The Pits of Grazna are said to contain creatures which feed on madness and sorrow and whose hunger will one day grow to consume the world. And the dark vassal of Lady Umber is mentioned as well, a creature that resembles the beasts of the Jungles of Khaffar, an eternal predator who passes silently between trees, shadows and worlds.
The creatures name is Ascian and the tome says that it served Lady Umber as an assassin because she bound the creature to her with an Amethyst Collar. Since the fall of Umber the creature is said to be free in the world, hunting as it desires and dragging those it stalks into endless darkness.
