UnitType.Quote: 'You've been found worthy of entertaining me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am currently on hiatus from demonic affairs and taking a leisure stroll in this lowly plane. Your little conflict sounds vaguely amusing and I'd consider intervening on your behalf. It's either %d gildar or your soul.
UnitType.Backstory: Demonic hierarchies are in a constant state of flux, subject to brutal coups orchestrated by ambitious upstarts or to the laziness and inertia that oftentimes afflict immortal rulers. The Balrog known as Demonatrix Astraloth has been playing that game forever. If he's knocked down the competition many times, he's been upstaged once or twice too. Feeling acute disinterest in current affairs, Astraloth, ruler of the Bareboned Plains of Fangeas, couldn't muster enough energy to wait for the next would be successor to make a move against him. Let the pathetic vultures fight over the festering carcass, it was time for a vacation. While searching for a resort offering slothful leisure and endless revelry, he noticed there was a nice little war going on in the material plane. Mayhap he would find a little distraction over there? Something to pass the time, at least for a little while.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'There's no such thing as a thief, there's only disagreement as to what belongs to whom.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Cards on table: the glitter stuff is mine for the taking. From the sound of it, there is %d gildar jingling in your pocket. How about handing it over?
UnitType.Backstory: Let's make something perfectly clear, the thief known as Fedruk Pocketcleaner (an alias no doubt) doesn't understand the concept of personal property. Suffering from acute kleptomania, lacking the most basic moral standards and sporting an ego which doesn't match his size, Fedruk will remorselessly steal anything that strikes his fancy. The intrinsic value of an object doesn't necessarily matter, he can steal treasures from affluent noblemen or despoil orphans of their last crumb of bread. Taking advantage of his diminutive size, he will dive into large crowds as a penniless pauper and emerge on the other side as a rich robber baron, emptying pockets, bags and satchels of their contents along the way. He's been known to enter taverns and offer rounds to the other patrons with the coin he pilfered from them mere moments ago. Everyone is convinced Fedruk has a huge stash hidden away somewhere but nothing could be further from the truth. For the thrill is in the taking and spending, not the hoarding and acquiring.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Wherever the winds send me I shall ride and my journeys are filled with their drafty whispers and turbulent conversations.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Fenwilde GaleDancer is said to have been born on the top of the world, looking over the edge, deep into the realms where Air rules with absolute power. Raised by harsh gales and playful gusts, her destiny was never in doubt: she would become the best Windrider of her generation. Deft of speed, she's also impulsive to a fault, streaking on the battlefield like an unrestrained lightning bolt on top of her foaming mount. Any opponent resilient enough to survive her initial thundering charge will find renewed respect for the Windriders she represents, these guardians of the heavens whose apparent frailty is nothing but a deadly illusion.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The Flames of my Faith Flicker Fervently, Feeding the Fires of the Furnace Fiercely Fuming Forever From the Forge of Felicity.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: The Great Combustion has been foretold and only the faithful will survive its orange caresses. For a modest offering of %d gildar, I will show you how to devote your life to the almighty Fire!
UnitType.Backstory: When his teachers sent him out to spread the flames of his faith to the world at large, they knew exactly what they were doing. Young Fluvio Moltenrock was deemed ready to burn off the last remnants of his innocence and jump into the unforgiving furnace of adulthood. It was now paramount to whittle that raw devotion into a shape that could weather the harshness of reality, to learn how Fire could articulate itself amongst lesser than ideal conditions. There would be no permanently fed bonfires, no more braziers supplied with spicy oils, there would only be the glowing embers of his beliefs to warm up his arduous journey. So much pressure placed on those inexperienced shoulders and for all the necessary reasons: he had to become the new arsonist of Faith Fire, the one to invoke the next set of sparks that would morph into all encompassing flames of destruction. The one to feed that eternal hunger for Fire can never, ever find satiation.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'How can I tame the rage inside when I am destined to ride in the eye of the storm?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Kequalys Welkinborn is a young Elf hailing from the world's rooftop, a Windrider in the making, that is if he can learn to curb his inner rage and explosive outbursts. In the wake of fistfights with his fellow trainees, insolent back talking to his instructors and recurrent reckless stunts, Kequalys was deemed unfit to be a Windrider and exiled from his aerie until he gained some maturity and learned the concept of humility. Literally grounded for his misbehavior, a complete inner make-over will be required to overturn his banishment and be allowed to resume his training. Only then would the elders consider to present him with his future partner, the life and pride of his creed, his own white horse to ride the indomitable winds and charge down on his enemies. A strong incentive to change indeed but the road ahead is twisted and arduous, with plenty of treacherous trails beckoning him off the redeeming path, tempting him to embrace his true violent nature and let those inaccessible dreams fade into the breeze.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My head may be far up in the clouds but my feet remain firmly entrenched in reality.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Nariam Nimbus is a young Cloud Giantess whose irrepressible curiosity pushed her to leave her snowy peaks and find for herself what the rest of the world had to offer. Marveling over the wonders to be seen on ground level, her vacationing time has turned into a permanent stay. Brimming with youthful optimism, she is determined to take giant steps (could she take any other?) towards self-discovery, learning to adapt her airy inclinations with the more concrete elements of the world. On rare occasions, when the clouds tug at her heart strings, she will climb the closest mountain in a few joyful leaps and take a breather of home.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I will be your guiding light through the treacherous swamps ahead and make the promise that your feet will never stray from the beaten path.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: There's an old folk saying that comes in handy when pointing out someone's foolishness: "go ahead and follow the Will O' Wisp to your doom". Mysterious creatures, these shimmering balls of swamp gas are believed to be the souls of the wicked, promising a safe journey through deceitful swamps only to lead those travelers foolish enough to trust them to a gruesome end, condemning their souls to remain on this plane as newly born Will O'Wisps. Others postulate they are agents of the Air Lords with an inscrutable agenda, alien minds communicating through shifting lights impossible to decipher for the untrained eye. Not much use in asking Oxidio Thanem whose answers will be vague and completely unhelpful. Guiding you through the swamps will be Oxidio's promise, your feet will never touch quicksand, stumble in a sinkhole or approach some hungry monster's lair. Surely you can trust this benevolent spirit? Maybe... but you should keep in mind that swamp gas has explosive properties and can blow up in your face without notice.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I can instantly recognize an arsonist when I meet one.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Start a fire here, burn a forest down over there, torch a city or two, I enjoy it so much I could do it for free. But since I also enjoy melting precious metals for the sake of it, my collaboration will cost you %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: An elemental spirit of feisty and fiery disposition, Sabruul Flamehead can be observed inhabiting active fires throughout Elemental. Whether dancing and feeding the raging flames of a destructive forest fire or relaxing in the slow combustion of a few logs in a commoner's hearth, Sabruul monitors his domain of flames, securing the gateways to his elemental dimension. If he has no interest in the dealings of mortals on principle, he has been known to strike temporary alliances. No matter the reason, whether it's curiosity, boredom or the sudden urge to spread fires around, he will respect the terms of the modus vivendi until the expiration date, probably when the hot flames of enthusiasm cool down to disappointing embers. In the meantime, just to be on the safe side, don't give him the tour of the library or show him your lace collection.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My faith is all encompassing and permeates everything. My faith is the very air that you breathe. Now tell me, what do you believe in?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: There is a point where the four winds collide, butting their contradictory forces like Hergon males fighting over a pack of healthy sows. And this is where you will usually find Shefyr Shiroccan, an indestructible tower of a Stormlord, at home within cataclysmic hurricanes and apocalyptic storms. So high and mighty, so defined by his intrinsic aerial nature, Shefyr Shiroccan rarely notices the happenings of the lower stratospheres. Indeed, who would have time to observe the ecology of lowly ants save for an idle scholar in need of an urgent professional reconversion? And yet there is a Faith war to be waged and won, which means direct intervention in the affairs of those scurrying anthills incapable of fending for themselves. The unbelievers need to be reminded where their loyalties should lie and Shefyr intends to provide that enlightenment forcibly if necessary. At the risk of falling flat on his face and for such a monumental ego, it would be a phenomenal crash.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The irrepressible inferno boiling inside of me is only awaiting release to become the funeral pyre of your adversaries.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Don't you just love how the flames sing and sway to their own beat? For %d gildar, we could dance to their sweet music together! Oh won't you?
UnitType.Backstory: A few years ago, the placid Kander was told by her mother that she was forbidden to go to the summer fair. She had to help her convalescent father in the fields and she was too young anyway. And she should pipe down. Under the verbal assault of her mother's unfair recriminations, Kander's anger switched from simmering to boiling. So much that she spontaneously combusted, reducing the farmhouse to a pile of smoking cinders in less time than a Dragon takes to incinerate a few dozen sacrificial virgins. Thus was born the Sorceress Kandercind, standing in the ruins of her childhood, basking in the heat of her newfound power and independence. No longer acknowledging her mother's authority (the latter having been somewhat severely chastised by the incident), she did go to the summer fair that day. Unfortunately for her, the tale of her fiery exploits had spread like wildfire and the only young boys willing to dance with her were a firefighter and a Water Mage apprentice.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let's feed the flames and reach boiling point together!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Do not speak to me of cooling down, Fire is my game and for %d gildar, I will become the searing sun of your nascent nation.
UnitType.Backstory: Tonakra Krespit was told she was born in a frying pan, in the high pitched racket of boiling oil. It was also mentioned in passing that the fumes in the stuffed kitchen were especially thick and black that day. Once frizzled, she was dumped unceremoniously directly into the fire, cooked alongside the roast being prepared to celebrate her birth. Her baptism of Fire accomplished, she was raised in reverence of the flames so she would always cherish them and long to increase their intensity. With such a severe conditioning, you'd think there would be no salvation outside the "raging bonfire" mentality. Thankfully, a strange phenomenon comes once in a while to break the baking mold. One day, while she was spiritually rising with the searing heat of a happy combustion, Tonakra came in contact with volatile Air elements and mystically detonated with the reactive revelation. When she finally recovered from the violent brainstorm, she realized she had unwittingly stolen knowledge from her aerial archenemies while retaining her boiling humors. Maybe it's only a logical progression, seeing as Air feeds Fire after all.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'll have sweat, blood and weeping widows! And a cool draft of beer to rinse it off afterwards!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Either you hire me and cough up %d gildar or you get mowed down and reduced to bloody bits. What will it be?
UnitType.Backstory: Don't ask Valgraff his point of view on the Empire's order of succession and its implications, or the historical importance of the Five Tribes Treaty, or even whether the chicken preceded the egg or the egg the chicken. Reflection is indeed not Valgraff's forte as he can't even begin to conceptualize the simplest of intellectual theories. What he lacks in brains however, he more than makes up for it in brawn. A formidable warrior to begin with, Valgraff has mastered the discipline of combining his blind faith and bottomless anger into overwhelming bursts of energy, effectively going berserk. His consciousness taking a back seat, the reptilian side of his brain assumes complete control, heightening his senses and allowing him to surpass all physical limitations. So yes, best not to pester Valgraff with pointless debates for he only knows to respond with a lethal edge.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Air is the quintessence of my essence. Now take deep breaths.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I can be of service. If you wish to hire me for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: As a true Air Elemental, Whooraghan is a de facto emissary of the cult built around its element, a natural embodiment of the Air Faith tapping into its considerable powers at will. A very difficult being to interact with, Whooraghan's reactions can best be defined as unpredictable, either a gentle flow akin to a summer breeze or the violent outbursts of a destructive and heartless tornado. There is no middle ground (air?) to be found. Whooraghan is obviously not a native of these lowly parts and will frequently remind those in its midst of its immortal extra planar qualities, assuming airs of superiority and building whirlwinds of condescension on a whim. There is one rule of thumb always to be followed: don't ever, ever approach Whooraghan close enough to breathe in parts of its essence. Recycled air can drive it into a storm of rage powerful enough to tear up the atmosphere and redefine the landscape.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: You are you nothing more than insects scurrying upon the shell of the world.
UnitType.Backstory:
Abeix, Who Dwells Beneath. Glory to any champion that is able to defeat Abeix. In times of old, he was one of the Five - the Elemental Lords worshipped by the peoples of Anthuane. But the coming of the Titans weakened his powers, and his followers' numbers. And the Cataclysm, some say, drove him mad.
Now he waits beneath the world, guardian of the Bhinadmi and the Bhinmuna, ready to fight any and all who would invade his domain. Know that few weapons can damage his armored hide; few fighters can survive his acidic spittle.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Delin, the Pyre of Man, is a creature of near-unimaginable power, said by some to be an Elemental Lord, though there is no record of Delin from before the cataclysm. His first appearance was over the city of Anniellum, where 200,000 perished when a volcano exploded and buried the city in lava and ash. Ever since, Delin has wandered the world, burning all he encounters... though he is said to take particular delight in the killing of men.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Morian, the Ruin of Summer, is an Elemental Lord, one of the Five worshipped by the Padars of old, Morian's power was greatly diminished with the coming of the Titans and their imprisonment of the world's mana within the Elemental shards. He haunts the swamps of the world now, a dark reflection of his former self, said to have lost all reason when the vast forests he ruled over were destroyed by the cataclysm.

UnitType.DisplayName: Torax, Who Grinds Mountains to Dust #E
UnitType.UnitDisplayName: Torax, Who Grinds Mountains to Dust #E

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory:
"I feared the sandstorm, until I reached its heart." - Myrimahus
Torax, Who Grinds Mountains to Dust, is one of the Five Elemental Lords worshipped by the Padars of old. An Elemental Lord unlike the others, who bears no apparent enmity to man or Fallen for the destruction of much of what he once ruled. When Torax does attack a caravan, or a group of adventures, his actions seem capricious... accidental... he leaves their remains strewn across the sands for the Wildings to salvage. Though his presence is a plague to the merchants that try to cross his deserts... to sages and adventurers he is a legend, a moving mountain cloaked by a sandstorm. To the wilding natives of the sands, Torax is a god. He shapes their world, claws out deep pits in the ground and changes the patterns of dunes larger than the great castles of the Verhaellem.

UnitType.DisplayName: Vetrar, Guardian of the World's End #E
UnitType.UnitDisplayName: Vetrar, Guardian of the World's End #E

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory:
"We are born in warmth, but the cold embrace of death awaits us." - Magnar III
Vetrar, Guardian of the World's End, is the Elemental Lord of the frozen tundra - the ice-covered wastes of the North, beyond which the world is said to end. Yet there are some who believe Vetrar's title does not refer to the land he watches over, but to the role he is destined to play at the end of time, when the world itself will end in a second Cataclysm.
"When all warmth bleeds out of the world, when summer has gone forever, when our monuments lie buried in snow and our cities have been ground to dust by glaciers, when the blood of the last of our children has been frozen by the endless winter, Vetrar will remain standing... the world's last champion. Then he will fulfill his charge, and destroy all life on Elemental... man, Fallen, sacred and profane alike."
Of the thousands that have set out to destroy Vetrar, only a handful has even reached the borders of his territory. Most have simply laid down in the snow and let death take them... a prefiguration, some believe, of how the world will end.
